intro: Soroseris hookeriana subsp. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy soroseris, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy foliage and stems, which provide a unique texture. It typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in temperate climates. The plant produces small yellow flowers, which are followed by fluffy, seed-bearing structures that aid in wind dispersal.
